intro: Calymmodon gracilis, commonly known as the slender calymmodon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Calymmodon gracilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
